intro: Euonymus lutchuensis, commonly known as the Lutchu euonymus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cistaceae. It is native to the island of Lutchu, which is now known as the Ryukyu Islands in Japan. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Due to its limited geographic range, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
